thread.title: Anthony Manton furious at portrayal on Married At First Sight
thread.title_full: Anthony Manton furious at portrayal on Married At First Sight | Daily Telegraph

author: Sally Rawsthorne
title: Anthony Manton furious at portrayal on Married At First Sight
text:
MARRIED at First Sight’s so-called villain Anthony Manton has hit out at the show, claiming the Nine show is a total fabrication.
In a furious spray — that a somewhat jaded Confidential has heard from many a reality “star” — Manton said that shockingly, the show was selectively editing and presents a warped view of the truth.
media_camera Anthony believes the show has been ‘edited’ to show him in an unflattering light.
“Anyone who watches those reality shows and thinks they are real must still believe in the tooth fairy,” said the race caller in an interview with his TAB radio colleagues yesterday.
“I know I haven’t been portrayed in the best possible light. There’s so much stuff that is edited out,” Manton, 33, ranted.
“In my case, there needs to be a villain in these shows, and I happen to be it on Married At First Sight.
“I’ll give you an example — last night’s episode we had homestays and Nadia and myself spent four days in my apartment in Sydney.
“We went to the races in that time, we had dinner with friends and family during that time, we cooked for each other, we had some great moments — and what do they play? Me blowing up about my Wi-Fi connection.
“In four days that’s all they play, a 30 second clip. That’s a great example of how heavily edited these shows are.”
media_camera Anthony is ‘married’ to glamorous flight attendant Nadia. Picture: Supplied/Nine
“Married” to glamorous flight attendant Nadia, the defensive comments come as Confidential hears that Manton has been seen around his Sutherland home looking very close to another woman and her children.
Speaking about his motivation to go on the fourth season of Nine’s televised social experiment, he said a lack of opportunity to meet women had spurred him on.
Related Susan calls out Anthony for bullying 0:33 Susan called out Anthony for the way he acted and how he bullied Cheryl when she returned on Married at First Sight. Courtesy: Channel Nine
February 20th 2017 2 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Susan calls out Anthony for bullying media_camera Being from a ‘real’ TV show Anthony was clearly caught offguard on ‘reality TV’ show Married at First Sight.
“The amount of hours I spend in the car each week, I don’t have a social life,” he claimed.
“That was my biggest motivation in going on the show, and I put my faith in the experts because they say they’re going to match you with someone that’s fantastic, you’re going to fall in love.
“I didn’t really have much to lose either. You’re exposing yourself big time to the world, your private life becomes very public.”
“I took a risk and I’m still hanging in there,” he added.
